title: What is your unpopular opinion about K-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Alright, here we go. These are my opinions and you are allowed to disagree with them, but be nice about it. BTS are overhyped, not overrated. I’m not an ARMY anymore, but I feel like some ARMYs exaggerate just how good the members really are. They have a good vocal line, but it’s not the best in the industry. The members are good at dancing, but not overall they aren’t the best in the industry. They do, however have one of the best rap lines in the industry.Everglow has become Mia and friends. I feel like Yuehua Entertainment is trying to give her the infamous Jennie Kim treatment, which isn’t fair to Mia and is also extremely unfair to the other members of the group. The line distribution for some of their songs is just wack. However, we should blame the company for this, not Mia.Itzy isn’t an all visual group. This may sound a bit mean, but I have to agree with this view. I’m not however, supporting the hate that certain members receive because of this. Yuna is weak for a visual and I don’t really see the hype around her looks. Yeji only stands out because of her cat like eyes. Without them, I don’t think she would be as pretty. I also don’t understand why people say Lia should be visual. She looks pretty average to me. However, do remember that beauty is subjective.Big 3 privilege is earned. SM, JYP and YG have produced groups which have helped kpop to develop as a genre and some of their groups have had the biggest impact on kpop. These three companies have proved to the South Korean public that they produce groups that have the best visuals, dance the best and sing the best. Moaning and complaining about the privilege certain groups have just because they’re from the Big 3 is unfair. They’ve earned these privileges. Getting into the Big 3 isn’t easy and for a good reason.I don’t find Hwasa attractive. I’m not trying to come off as rude, but I find her features too harsh for me and can understand why many kpop fans don’t find her attractive.BTS only won so many daesangs this year because Bighit is partners with CJ E&M, who own MNET. Sorry, not sorry.TXT is only popular because of BTS. If they weren’t from Bighit, then they wouldn’t be as popular as they are today. Majority of their fans are ARMY, who are either Bighit stans or support them because they support BTS.Seventeen not winning the Best Dance Performance Male Group daesang is a joke. For the past two years they won it, but now when they’ve come out with their best choreography they don’t win it? Boy With Luv’s choreography was way easier than Fear’s and it actually broke my heart when they didn’t win.Most of Stray Kids’s songs are noise. Honestly, I know that so many people will disagree with this, but a lot of their songs give me a headache. I think that they should take a break from self producing and that if they do, they could have their breakthrough song.Woojin left Stray Kids for a reason. If he broke a rule and did something stupid, then he should’ve left. This may be harsh, but it’s true. If he potentially jeopardised his group’s future, then it only seems right that he should leave.The amount of hate Blackpink receive from the kpop community is absolutely disgusting, especially Jennie. So many kpop fans love to bring these beautiful, talented girls down just to promote their faves and that is just low. So low. It’s not their fault that they only come back once a year and that YG won’t let them have a full album. There’s a reason that they got into YG. Constantly belittling Jennie for being ‘lazy’ is just annoying now. She was clearly going through something at the time and YG didn’t let her recover, which just show how much of a piece of sh*t he is.YG gambling his artists profits was just so wrong and proves how much of a bad person he really is. I just don’t understand why he would do that. Now his artists can never get their hard earned money back, which is just wrong. What was the point of them working hard to earn money if their CEO will just gamble it away? Once again proves how YG is a bad person. He purposely sabotaged the group his wife was in: Swi.T just to get with his underage wife at the time. Also, his “love story” is really weird and kind of disturbing.It’s ok if Wonho doesn’t return to Monsta X. He made his choice, even if it was a rushed decision and we have to respect it. If he won’t come back, then trending hashtags and trying to get him back is probably making it worse for him. If he doesn’t want to come back, then he doesn’t and nothing will change how he feels.Fancy deserved song of the year, not Boy With Luv. Enough said.I don’t like the ARMY, at all. At this point, nothing can really change my mind. Feel free to try and convince me, though.Ateez will be the next big thing, not Stray Kids. They’ve already achieved so much in just one year and have a huge international following. I have a gut feeling that they will blow up in the near future. Stray Kids could, but it’s quite unlikely now.Oneus have a bright future ahead of them.NCT’s breakthrough song could’ve been Boss, if SM didn’t do them dirty. That song is extremely popular and if SM let them promote it then it definitely could’ve been their breakthrough song. So many idols have covered the song and I’m 100% sure that this would have been their breakthrough into the industry.I only find Ateez’s San and Hongjoong attractive. A lot of people say that Yeosang reminds them of Taeyong, but I don’t really see it. People say that Mingi is also a reason they’re so popular, but to me he doesn’t really stand out.Heechul and Momo being happy is all that matters. The relationship is between those two. It’s not Heechul, Momo and stan Twitter. As a grown woman, Momo can date whoever she wants. All of these people hating on them should have the same energy for Beyonce and Jay Z and Priyanka and Nick. They should be in jail too, right? Their love is unacceptable as well, isn’t it? Basically, it’s not your business. Those two care less about what you think. To them you’re all strangers, nobodies even.Chaeyeon deserved first place. She was clearly one of the most, if not the most talented trainee out of all of them. If Korea wasn’t so focused on visuals and more on talent than she would have won. We can’t change the ranking though, but we all know who deserved the win.Lisa is one of the best dancers of the third generation. Once again, I feel like just because she’s from Blackpink there’s a certain bias against her. Lisa is a really good dancer and has proved that time and time again.BTS didn’t pave the way. There were a lot of idols before them that had a huge impact on kpop and started the Hallyu wave that really solidified kpop as a genre and popularised it in South Korea. Just because they blew up internationally, and helped it become a global genre doesn’t mean that they paved the way.BTS blew up because of good luck. I’m not saying that the boys aren’t talented, but there were a lot of reasons that they blew up the way they did. The main reason was that there was no leading boy group in the West. This meant that inevitably there was going to be a new big boy group that blew up. BTS did with DNA, which led to them winning the Top Social Artist Award at the 2017 BBMAs. This then led to them becoming even more popular as people wondered who these boys were and here we are today. If there was a popular boy group like One Direction in the West, I’m 100% certain that BTS wouldn’t have blown up the way they did.Itzy’s I’m not like other girls concept is annoying and unoriginal. After a while, people are going to get tired of it. Their songs are also really weird in a way? Like, the way Icy starts gives me a bit of a headache and it’s quite odd. Hopefully they’ll have a different concept for their next comeback.I don’t like IU. I understand that she’s really talented and has great visuals, but I don’t really like any of her songs except Good Day and Blueming. I really don’t like her music and don’t get the hype around her, I guess.You don’t get to decide what a true fan is: that’s arrogant and just confusing in a way. Like, who are you to suddenly declare yourself an expert on what a fan truly is? By definition, a fan is: a person who has a strong interest in or admiration for a particular person or thing. Saesangs are fans. Solo stans are fans. Toxic fans are still fans. Just because you don’t like them, doesn’t mean that they aren’t a fan. I don’t know when the kpop community suddenly decided to ignore this definition and make up their own, but that’s not it. All of the three mentioned above are fans, they’re just fans that the kpop community doesn’t like.BTS can only trust ARMY financially. That’s literally the only thing that they can trust ARMY to do. When Jungkook was with his friend and was just trying to hang out like a normal person, ARMY overreacted. I felt so bad for Jungkook and his friend. I felt most for the manager though. Poor guy. They can’t even go on vacation for more than a month. A month, without the ARMY forcing them to stop their break abruptly. The Jimin in Paris incident is just … unspeakable. I’m speechless. Honestly, it’s just disappointing.Bighit probably pays Dispatch to keep them quiet. It’s understandable though. Knowing how unpredictable ARMY can be, it’s better that they don’t have any dating scandals. If they do, I’ll be quite scared for their partner. ARMY can be really mean when they want to be. God forbid they actually do.Seventeen has the best choreographies and one of the best discographies in kpop. Nothing more to say, really.Don’t Wanna Cry deserved better.Shine deserved better. I’m still a tad upset that the song didn’t win any awards.Pentagon deserve their first win. They’ve got 12 albums and still don’t have a single win. Hopefully it’ll be this year. They have some bops.The only attractive BTS members are Jungkook, Taehyung and Jin.Everglow didn’t deserve their first win. Dreamcatcher did. They only won because Dreamcatcher were robbed and that’s the tea.I liked Flower Shower. It was refreshing to see Hyuna do a more innocent concept. I really liked the beat drop. I feel like everyone expected her to do another sexy concept and were disappointed when she didn’t.Everglow won’t blow up. Their songs use too much EDM and they aren’t really memorable. I get that using EDM may be their concept, correct me if I’m wrong, but I don’t think that South Korea is ready for that. Also, for me the beat drops are kind of predictable- it’s always another hardcore EDM one each time.People aren’t grateful for the visuals bringing attention to the group, which makes no sense at all. You should be grateful that the group is getting attention. Even if people support the group because of the visual then it’s fine; it benefits the group in the long run. I bet you the group would rather get attention because of the visual than no attention at all.I don’t get why people hate the idea of visuals. Without EXID’s Hani, they would probably be unknown. Same for Eunwoo and Astro. That’s the whole point of visuals, to bring attention to the group because they’re beautiful/handsome. What do you want visuals to do, ruin their face? It’s not their fault that they’re extremely attractive.New kpop fans should be aware of 2nd and 1st generation groups and idols and how they helped to pave the way and had a huge impact on kpop. I’m not saying that they have to support them, but they should be aware of how they helped shape the industry and make it what it was today. There’s a reason that your faves look up to them.Idols are meant to be better than you. That’s the whole point, they’re meant to be more attractive than you, to sing/rap way better than you and to dance better than you. That’s the whole point and concept of idols; you’re meant to look up to them because of this.TVXQ’s Mirotic is one of the best kpop songs. The lyrics are really interesting and creative and tell a pretty cool story. The dance is great and the vocals are just, *chef’s kiss*.Most idols personalities are fake and that’s ok. Being an idol is a job to them. If the idols told fans what they were really like and what they really do, they probably wouldn’t be popular and the kpop industry wouldn’t be as big as it was today.Idols hook up all the time. Fans who continue to deny this amuse me. Idols are working in an industry with extremely hot people with amazing bodies, it’s natural that they would hook up with each other. All they have to do is hide it from the fans and media and they’re fine. I’m not saying that all idols hook up with each other, but some idols who do hook up with fellow idols.Dating bans don’t exist. Companies do this to satisfy the fans. If some fans knew that their favourites were dating from debut, they would go ballistic. Idols are taught how to hide this from the media. How do you think Hyuna and E’Dawn weren’t exposed after so many years until they decided to reveal it?I don’t get why Taehyung vaping is a big deal. ARMYs say that they’ll support them no matter what, but when a member does something they don’t agree with, suddenly they’re a “bad example” and “cancelled”. Taehyung is a grown man and has the right to vape if he wants to. This is why they don’t share anything with you, because you guys can’t just say “Ok, they have the right to live their life how they want to.” and support them. BTS don’t actually need ARMYs approval. They need their money.It’s ok to stop stanning a group because of the fandom. When you become a fan of a group, a fandom plays a big role in your experience and interactions with the group. If the fandom is toxic and it’s making you uncomfortable or affecting you negatively, then you have every right to stop supporting the group. For some people, they associate the group with their negative experience and that’s fine. Ultimately, a fandom does represent a group.2019 MAMA was disrespectful to every artist that attended, even artists that weren’t invited, except for BTS. Stray Kids and many other idols weren’t invited despite having a good year. Chungha performed really early on and had a short stage. That just infuriates me because a) she performed before the rookies, despite being one of South Korea’s most successful soloists and b) she got a really short stage. They did GOT7 so dirty that I cannot. I literally cannot. Confiscating their table was a bit extreme. Also, where were the female idols/artists? 40 minutes just for BTS. That’s not really their fault, but it’s still extremely unfair to the other artists. It was basically the popularity awards, so obviously BTS ended up winning everything. They are also the only artists that got a full fancam, which is just f*cking b*llshit at this point. If they had allowed cameras we could have gotten full fancams for every artist, but we didn’t. They didn’t record reactions for the best part of many idols performances: Twice’s dance break and Seventeen’s Fear Intro when Wonwoo ate a flower. They were incomplete and that’s the worst part. Should’ve just called it the 2019 BTS Awards.SM are superior. They produce the best idols out of the Big 3. All of their groups are labelled flops at debut, but end up being the most successful and having a big impact on kpop, EXO being a great example.JYP isn’t as great as everyone think it is. They overwork their artists (Twice being the best example) and neglect their boy groups, GOT7 being the biggest example. JYP himself also limits GOT7’s potential by not letting Jaebum release songs because he doesn’t like it. Some of them are bops, though?, so I don’t understand his logic. I get that he’s passionate about music and that he founded the company, but by rejecting songs he doesn’t like he’s really stopping them from becoming more successful, especially in Korea.I don’t like Loona. There’s just too many members and way too many things to remember. Their concept is a big turn off for me.Boy groups > Girl groups. I listen to a lot of music by girl groups, but I don’t really feel the need to stan them. They don’t appeal to me as much as boy groups do.Everyone talks about the over sexualiation of females in the industry, but not males. To me, it just shows how hypocritical kpop fans are. You don’t mind when male idols show off their abs, or arms and wear really tight and revealing outfits. You also don’t hesitate to comment extremely inappropriate things about them, but God forbid anyone does that to a female idol/s. “Disgusting! “you cry. “You’re over sexualising them!” you say angrily. For these kpop fans, it’s a dOuBle StAnDard. It’S UnfAir. YoU sHouLdN’t seXuAliSe tHem tHiS mUch.Not every kpop song has to be about societal issues. I think that it’s ok to have songs which are carefree and aren’t serious. Blackpink are a good example. Their songs are bops and don’t discuss any serious issues, which is fine. Seventeen’s Thanks is dedicated to their Carats and is quite a deep song. NCT 127’s Highway to Heaven Eng. Version is all about sex and is still still super catchy. Majority of BTS’s songs are about societal issues such as loving yourself. Not all of them are bops, but some of them are, which is fine. Music isn’t limited to one type of song or one type of concept, so kpop shouldn’t be as well.Songs about societal issues are becoming boring and the concept is overused. The idea of loving yourself has definitely become cliche in kpop. Songs focusing on society are ok, but now here are so many songs about loving yourself and how society is unfair and it’s honestly become boring. Write songs about other things.I didn’t like Map of the Soul: Persona at all. It felt almost messy to me in a way? I understand that it was for ARMY, but it just wasn’t my cup of tea. Seventeen’s Thanks seems like a better way to do it for me. Hopefully their next comeback will be better.Boy With Luv didn’t feel like a collab with Halsey. She just sang the chorus and that’s it. Isn’t a collab meant to be more than that? know that a lot of people said that she got more lines in the album, but if I don’t like the title track then why should I listen to the album?I want BTS to have a really dark and unpredictable comeback, like Mamamoo’s Hip. Hip exceeded everyone’s expectations, because no one expected it to be what it was. I want BTS’s comeback to more hip hop focused and the title track to be more focused on rap than vocals,IOI could have been the nation’s girl group. They were done dirty. I find it unfair that when Izone debuted that they had a contract for 2 years and 6 months, but IOI only got one for a year. I know that they had a contract and were a temporary group, but they were so popular whilst active and could have been extremely successful if they didn’t disband. Like, Twice level popular.Idols should tell their fans off when they’re out of line. A great example of this is EXO. By doing this it makes the fandom think about what they’ve done and almost always results in the fans improving their behaviour, because as fans we never want to disappoint our idols. I know that if Seventeen ever told Carats off that I’d die on the inside. Maybe I’d cry. Anway, by doing this it teaches the fandom what not to do and also shows others that kpop fans can mature and aren’t always whiny and regret their actions.Love Scenario is Ikon’s best song.Blackpink’s Jennie has great stage presence. All of the girls have really good stage presence, but for some reason Jennie stand outs more than the other members for me.Really Really was Winner’s peak.Survival shows are becoming boring and Produce 101 Season 2 was the peak for them. I understand that companies and TV networks wanted to reproduce the success of the Produce series, but now the groups that come out of them aren’t really that appealing any the idea has become overused to the point of being lazy for me.There’s always social context behind the way Korean fans are acting the way they are. Sometimes international fans don’t understand the way Koreans fans act the way they do in certain situations, such as the Produce 101 scandal. The Korean fans were mad and acted like that because of the college admission scandals and the elite abusing their power being exposed in South Korea. International fans wouldn’t know that.SuperM aren’t a flop. I feel like they’ll achieve great things in the future and that their next comeback will be extremely successful. Just because you don’t like them, doesn’t make them a flop.International ARMYs took it too far with the DKDKTV controversy. Look, you have the right to disagree with opinions. That’s perfectly fine. What is not ok is sending death threats and harassing someone because you disagree with their views. The hate that they received was absolutely disgusting and unacceptable. The I-ARMYs that did this made you guys look like psychopaths to everyone else and made the fandom look a lot worse. Practically every comment on that video was just the ARMY hating on them. It was horrible. By reacting like this, you make the ARMY look even worse than it already is and give the fandom a bad name. There’s a reason you guys are disliked and labelled as the most toxic fandom. Hopefully next time something like this happens, you guys react in mature way whilst also getting your point across.K.WILL’s Please Don’t is the greatest kpop MV of all time. Literally nothing can top this for me, nothing. If you haven’t watched the MV you should definitely check it out!Kim Jaejoong is the original visual. I may be gay, but I’m not blind. Jaejoong was and 14 years later still is one of the hottest men in the kpop industry. Without him, I’m not sure that the concept of having a visual would even exist. I’m a bit surprised that a lot of the newer kpop fans don’t know about him. He’s also a really sweet person. So, in conclusion check out Kim Jaejoong!Not everyone has to stan the groups from smaller/unknown companies. I’ve noticed that lately it’s kind of become a trend for people to act like they’re superior to kpop fans who stan groups from the Big 3 or well known companies. I honestly do not understand that mentality and the fans who keep bragging about it and trying to shove the groups down everyone’s throats are annoying. Look, it’s okay to love and promote your faves, but acting like you’re better than others and constantly bragging about them and then shaming people who don’t stan them is annoying. There’s probably a reason that people don’t stan that group and it’s very unlikely that they’re going to blow up and revolutionise kpop like some of you guys claim they will. Stop shoving your faves down other people’s throats.Stan Twitter is a shit hole. Nothing more to say about this.Saying that the toxic fans are only a minority and trying to dismiss them is actually so rude and selfish. Let's take the ARMY as an example, as they’re one of the biggest and unfortunately, problematic fandoms in kpop. Whenever someone says that ARMYs are toxic and calls you guys out for your behaviour, majority of you guys like to reply by saying that they’re only a minority and not everyone's like that. This also applies to practically every other fanbase, but you guys are the biggest fandom and are the representation of kpop to those who only know about BTS and their fanbase. Let’s say that only 10% or even 5% of you guys are toxic, because like you say it’s only the minority. There are about 136.4 million of you guys out there [1], so that means the toxic 10% and 5% of you guys respectively are 13,640,000 and 6,820,000 people. That’s a hell of a lot of people and I’m willing to bet that there are a lot more ARMYs than this. Whether you like it or not, that’s a huge number of people for a minority. Dismissing these people and their harmful and hurtful actions highlights a huge problem with the ARMY and kpop stans: the inability to accept responsibility. Even if it’s not you or majority of the ARMY that are being mean or just toxic in general, you guys need to accept responsibility for what they’ve done. You can’t just dismiss it because you think that they’re not a “true” fan like a lot, and I mean a lot of you like to claim. You know what that shows others? That you guys can’t accept responsibility and like to shift the blame around, because you know they they’re wrong, but you don’t want the fandom to look bad so obviously the only solution is to just not accept responsibility or apologise for their actions. That’s selfish and immature.Another example for a girl group would be LOONA fans, who are known for posting stuff like this:   You know what that is? Disgusting. Disrespectful. Just wrong. And a lot of LOONA fans don’t like to accept responsibility for this: “the community likes to say these people are trolls trying to insult the group but troll or not Loona would be sickened to know that this is going on.”[2] I’m sorry, but not every single one of these people are trolls. Some of them are LOONA fans and claiming that they’re not true fans and using that logic to not accept responsibility and shift the blame to them is disgusting. It’s more disappointing than disgusting really. I understand that it’s not all of you, but shifting the blame just makes it look worse in my opinion. Just apologise for it. You guys don’t get to decide what a “true fan” is. Even if they’re toxic and do stuff like this, they’re still a fan, because: By definition, a fan is: a person who has a strong interest in or admiration for a particular person or thing.You guys can’t just pick and mix what type of fans you guys like. That’s not how it works. Footnotes[1] How many fans does BTS have?[2] K-pop stan on twitter uses mass shooting to promote music group.

These probably aren’t all unpopular opinions but I still feel like saying them. This will probably be a really long post (and it will most likely not even cover half of my opinions), so sorry in advance. Hope you read and see why I’ve said each thing. BlackPink are over hyped:BlackPink had one comeback this year, and it wasn’t as good as it should have been. Don’t get me wrong, they are a descent group, but their fans massively over hype them.Square Up was disappointing:The vocals were lackluster and the songs did not seem well produced. Considering that they had a year to work on their new album, it should have been a lot better. On top of that, Forever young is a song that they have been working on since pre-debut yet it wasn’t great.It should have been a full studio album that was produced a lot better. Sure their songs come off as good at first, but after a couple of listens you realize that the’re actually pretty average.BlackPink have year long breaks. They should train during them.When BlackPink came back, I at least expected that the would have improved their vocals, technique and stability, but they had actually gotten worse. Rose’s technique will destroy her voice eventually and when they’re performing her vocals are unstable. Jisoo is the most stable member and with better technique, she would be even better.YG needs to train they’re idols well:YG artists all have great potential but his idol groups have bad technique. His vocalists have unsafe techniques that could eventually destroy their voices.Jennie stans need to admit her faults:I understand that she has motion sickness, but that doesn’t give her the right to put no effort into group performances. It makes no sense that she performs her solo at their concert perfectly without motion sickness, yet when the next group performance comes, she has it again. Medicine for motion sickness does not wear off that quickly. All the other girls perform their songs with full effort, yet Jennie mixes sequences in their dance and even her parts at times. She’s stopped trying which is rude and disrespectful to the fans who paid to watch them perform in concert.This actually applies to all KPop stans, it’s just that Jennie’s scandal right now has made it obvious that some of her stans need to mature and learn that she has her faults.BlackPink are not an insanely unique and original group:BlackPink are 2NE1 2.0. They didn’t invent the girl crush concept and by no means do they perform it the best.Some BTS songs have lost their touch:A common recurring theme that I have found in DNA, Fake Love and Idol is that they have lost their unique touch. From debut to the Wings/YNWA era, BTS’ songs all had this personal touch from each member that made it uniquely a BTS song but recently their songs have lost it. It seems that they did the songs exactly how the producers had the guide done and in all honesty, it’s a bit disappointing. I understand that the producers have a plan for how the song should sound, but they need to allow them to add a unique touch to the songs their given.Their tracks were also not produced as well as the could be. Don’t get me wrong, they were decent, but they actually could have been a lot better. I feel like they were too rushed, they should have sat on the songs a bit longer so that they were the best they could be as their kinda’ average.Euphoria shouldn’t of had the track it did:I feel like due to the message that Euphoria had, I felt like the track was too much. Due to the extreme drop and the heavy dub-step back track, I felt like the message and vocals were overpowered. I personally think that Euphoria should of had backtrack that used real instruments.BigHit should release an acoustic version of it. Piano, acoustic guitar, maybe even a cajon (box drumb) and Jungkook’s vocals. The lyrics of the song deserve a raw, stripped back version in which we can fully hear the emotion in Jungkook’s voice and the lyrics. It would help bring more meaning to the song.EDIT: I’m kinda tempted to pull Jungkook’s vocals off the track and just make an acoustic version myself. I’ll see how I feel over these next 2 months of holiday. Who knows?TWICE aren’t untalented:TWICE are actually a talented group, and they deserve the recognition they have gotten. They’re all good vocalist and the real problem is that the songs that they have been given are all at the top of their range. JYP needs to give them a song that better fits their range and allow Momo and Sana to sing with their real voices.TWICE members can all dance. They may not have the hardest choreo, but that doesn’t mean they’re bad dancers. The songs they were given, and the trend that JYP is trying to make them work with wouldn’t suit a high intensity dance.TWICE did their concerts all fully live as they wanted to give their fans the best experience possible. Their vocals during the concert were all stable and they have been performing stably in their live stages recently. Their live vocals are better than quite a few groups.Give them a chance. Don’t just jump on the bandwagon of hate because others are on it.Dahyun isn’t the weak link in TWICE:Dahyun is the TWICE member who I feel has a lot of potential if not the most. She wasn’t accepted by all of the Big 3 companies for no reason.Dahyun is actually very pretty. Her visuals perfectly fit Korean standards and I actually don’t understand when people say she’s ugly. Yes, her visuals may not be for everyone, but that doesn’t make her ugly.If JYP gave her the right training, she could easily become one of the best vocalist in TWICE. She has one of the most versatile vocal tones in TWICE. Her tone (don’t go getting annoyed at me ARMY), is very similar to BTS Jungkook’s. I’m not saying that she should become main vocal, I’m simply saying that their vocal tones are similar. They both have naturally soft, kinda breathy tones that sound good in ballad songs yet when they add power, they are very strong and suit upbeat songs. With the right training, she could be a great vocalist.JYP needs to train her rap more. She has a good tone, but her flow is slightly off. She needs to be taught how to properly ride the rhythm when rapping so that she can rap to her full potential. It’s not always off, only sometimes.She is not the weakest dancer in TWICE. She was scouted by JYP due to her solo dance performance at her school festival. Dahyun is one of the strongest dancers in the group and always performs well. Her stage presence is definitely one of, if not the strongest in the group and her dancing is always smooth and pleasing to the eye. As well as that, she is the only other member other than Momo that has participated in choreography (I’m pretty sure that none of the other members have).She, if she gets the training, could do well in a solo. I’m not saying leave the group, I’m just saying that she could do a solo project in the future. Or the girls’ could one day release an album with solo tracks on it. Her voice would fit various concepts.I don’t think that she would actually do poorly at a sexy or girl crush concept if she practiced the dance. She is just someone who isn’t sure at how to freestyle these things and so when asked, she automatically goes for her fun dance as she doesn’t know how to do these things on the spot. Remember their ‘Now’ cover. She could also do well at acting in the future if she ever wanted to.TWICE don’t need to change their concept:Not every group needs to change and try out new concepts. The girls will probably try out a new one soon as they are 3. Rather than change their concept, the girls can just mature it. They stick with their unique colorpop genre yet change their music up.Red Velvet’s concept changing seems kinda’ lostI understand that they have both their Red and Velvet sides, but their Red side seems kinda’ ‘spastic’. It kinda’ seems like SM either doesn’t care enough or Red Velvet can’t decide. Some of their songs aren’t well produced. RBB did not seem ready for release and the Halloween concept M/V at the end of November made no sense. They should have waited a while longer and improved the song.They need to finally decide what type of music they want to release and produce it well. I think that when they finally do this, they’ll finally start to have a clearer image and know what works for them.Some 3rd Generation Idols lack stage presence, especially compared to 2nd gen idolsIdols in the 3rd Gen should work on their stage presence. Red Velvet, although a talented group, have underwhelming lives due to having practically no stage presence.Groups also need to work on having a strong stage presence, no matter the circumstances. I understand if their down due to loss of someone close, but if its just because they can’t be bothered, than that’s a different story. TWICE and BTS are heavily overworked and have the busiest schedules, yet they are still the two groups in the 3rd gen of idols who have some of the best consistent stage presence.(G)I-dle isn’t as amazing as fans sayAlthough decent, their title tracks lack a sense of umph. Their choruses are weak, and they could do better. Fans only hype them because of their concept and different sounding songs.Soyeon, although good, is not the best female idol rapper of 3rd gen idols.They shouldn’t have covered Fake Love. Their cover of Fake Love ended up fully disclosing their weaknesses as a group. They lack the vocal and rap skills needed to perform it well. As well as that, it is a song that heavily needs a strong stage presence if performed live, which the lack. Soojin is no doubt their best performer live, yet she was barely in the center.KPop fans need to stop viewing idols as objectsI understand that due to how companies promote idols, they can come off that way, but they are not objects. They should be able to freely date and live their lives without worrying what their fans will think. You don’t own them and it is not their job to stay single so that they please you. They’re human beings, they are allowed to fall in love and date.KPop companies need to change their approach of how they promote groupsCompanies are the reason that fans are like this. I understand that it is to draw more people in, but it causes some fans to have an unhealthy obsession with idols and causes them to do dangerous and unhealthy things.Some fans need to calm their farm:I understand that you stan a group, but there’s no need to go onto other groups video and ‘stan xxx’ or ‘xxx is better than them’. It’s unnecessary and immature.If you dislike fanwars so much, why do you say rude things about other groups. The first step to stopping these fanwars is to stop doing things to start them and understanding the difference between criticism and hate.Don’t criticize a group if you don’t know anything about what you’re criticizing them on. I criticize groups on vocals, rap, lyrics, dance, production and more because I learn music where we get vocal training, producing and song writing as well as delivery, reading and composing music, differing between live vocals and lip syncing. I also have learnt multiple instruments. When I was younger I trained in ballet, contemporary and hip-hop. I’ve performed on stage and have learnt how to properly perform on stage and have stage presence. Unless you actually know what you’re talking about, don’t go on about it. If you do, don’t be rude about it.NCTSM should allow NCT to become popular in America naturally, not force it. Their interviews are awkward and most Americans haven’t heard of them.SM should either allow Dream to remain as they are or create a sub-unit with only those members. Their music has matured since their debut and if they get new younger members, they may have to change back to their old concept.EXO ‘Tempo’ is an underwhelming copy of NCT ‘Regular’Same chord progression, similar buildup, same style. They’re practically the same song. When I first heard Tempo I thought I was listening to a vocal version of Regular.EDIT: So after seeing people say that these two songs aren’t similar I went back and listened to them again, but the are still really similar to me. Yes, I was a bit harsh but it was mainly because I thought that EXO could have had a better song. I understand that while Regular is focused on rap Tempo shows off EXO’s vocals but that wasn’t what I was talking about. I was talking about the backtracks and how they are very similar. Both songs have a different tempo (pun unintended) but the style, chord progressions and beats used in both tracks were very similar. The producer on both tracks is the same so it’s understandable but even then, I wish that they had made some other changes to the backtrack. I like both songs, but the back tracks get to me.Unless a group is absolutely talent less (which should be impossible in KPop) they’re not overratedKPop idols train so hard to debut and the deserve recognition for that. No group is overrated, they’re simply over hyped. Nobody has the right to call a KPop group overrated, they work hard and any recognition they get, they deserve.Edit: Over hype= A group or idol who’s fans give them too much hype and credit for what the do. They deserve recognition but fans need to tone it down.Overrated= A group who doesn’t deserve the recognition or hype that they get. Too much attention for doing barely anything. Their fans and them rate themselves to high.Similar but different.Fans should stan a group because they like their music or their personalitiesI understand if you stan a group because of those reasons, but if you only stan them because they’re good looking/pretty or you want to date or marry them, then are you actually a fan? Stan groups and artist for real reasons.Shipping can be immature and cause groups to be uncomfortableShipping between members in groups can make them uncomfortable and awkward with each other. It’s okay if you like them as friends, but if you do it sexually, you can make the members awkward around each other. BTS said in their early years that they use to get fan letters with fan fics, as well as go online and see videos and post saying that members like each other and are sexually active with each other. RM commented how these things made them feel uncomfortable with one another and that he wishes that fans would tone it down.Shipping idols who have barely any to no interactions makes no sense. I understand that you like them, but that doesn’t automatically mean they’re dating. If you want to ship, that’s fine, but don’t go and do some extreme reach and make edits just to support our ship.Don’t hate on other peoples ships if they’re not causing any harm. Just because they don’t have the same ship as you, doesn’t mean you can hate on them. I have seen people who ship idols with literally no interactions hate on fans who ship idols that actually have some interactions and could be real.In all honesty, it’s better if your shipping is only going as far as friendship, after that it’s a bit of a stretch. Imagine how awkward it could be for your idol if they’re in a relationship and you guys are shipping them with all these other people. Imagine how even more awkward it’d be if your shipping them with a member from their significant others group that isn’t them. These things can hurt people.Idols don’t have to tell us everything and they don’tIt’s their private lives. If they don’t want to tell us, there’s a reason.I always see people say that because their idol said “I don’t want to date a celebrity” that they won’t and then get hurt if they do. Have you ever thought that maybe they so that so that fans don’t realize that they’re in a relationship? Just saying…Also, if you have noticed that it’s possible that an idol is dating, rather than tell everyone, protect them. They’ll be very grateful when they reveal their relationship. I’ve seen some fans do this and I honestly love it.Dispatch needs to get a lifeRather than following around Korean celebrities all the time and revealing that they’re in a relationship when they don’t want anyone to know, why can’t they just talk about what idols are doing that they want the public to know. Dispatch has ruined so many relationships due to revealing them early on.They should do more reports like the one they did about Inkigayo. First time I think that I actually thanked Dispatch.Why do people in the industry reveal relationships before they get comfortableI understand if you have permission to talk about it and give hints as long as you don’t give names, but why do they feel the need to go and tell Dispatch that two idols are dating. A perfect example of this is Momoland Daisy and iKON YunhyeongBe like iKONics guysI’m sure that there are other fandoms like this, but iKONics are literally the only fandom who I see tell the idols they like to date. It’s actually funny sometimes. Like iKONics are a really cool fandom. Minus the few ‘fans’ who like to go try and have a go at other groups and fandomsAnd that is all for this installment of my unpopular KPop opinions. If you like it than thank you, if you don’t, well oh well. There’s a reason they’re opinions. If you’re curious about anything I wrote, ask down below and I’ll answer. -Erin

okay, here’s some unpopular opinions i’m willing to bet you’ve never seen before: 1.) i don’t think that wendy’s “let it shine” part had any place in happiness  yeah, this is probably one of the more controversial ones. don’t get me wrong, i love this part of the song, but i just don’t think that it fit the overall vibe of the song. it sounded like it was meant for a different song, and it just didn’t really work for me. 2.) i don’t think that itzy’s concept is getting old  okay, everyone who says that their concept is getting repetitive are actually getting on my nerves a little. they’ve only had three comebacks with the same concept, and a lot of people started saying that they icy and dalla dalla were too similar because they had the same concept was started to really annoy me. they had only had two comebacks at that time with the same general vibe and their concept is much more unique than a lot of k-pop groups right now. i don’t see as many people coming for groups like blackpink and everglow who do the girl crush concept a lot. 3.) i liked boy with luv  i know that a lot of people didn’t like this comeback because they didn’t like their concept compared to wings era and such, but i actually liked this song?? i don’t know, i felt like the dreamy concept was a good look for them. plus, it’s nice to see them branching out and trying new concepts. 4.) autotune needs to stop  autotune in k-pop has gotten really excessive recently, and i don’t understand why. i like hearing natural voices rather than robots. sometimes it gets to the point where i can’t understand which idol is singing because they sound so manipulated. i get it if you’re using a little bit to make the song sound better, but it gets annoying at times. 5.) fourth gen performances are weak  companies are so obsessed with projecting this image of perfection on their idols, and i don’t think that they realize the reason why we start stanning groups is when we see their true personalities because they’re a lot more likable than the fake one’s they’re forcing them to have. i like watching idols having fun on stage, or getting the crowd involved, or changing up the choreography a bit, but there’s no variation on different stages. most idols just do the same choreography and lip sync, and there’s really no excuse for that. why do you train all those years just to pretend to sing a song? 6.) twice didn’t need to change their concept  don’t get me wrong, i love their new elegant concept, but i miss their cute concept too. i know that their new concept is going to bring in a lot of new fans which is good for the group, but i think that cute concepts are dying out which makes me really sad. like, i’m glad for this new era of k-pop, but it’s focused a lot more on mature/girl crush concepts and i wish we could have more innocent/cute concepts as well. 7.) somi should have left jyp  …she just shouldn’t have joined the black label. somi has so much potential, but she’s basically faded out of the spotlight ever since she joined yg. we all knew that if somi had debuted in itzy, she would have overshadowed the group by so much and that just wouldn’t have been a good move on jyp’s part. i would have loved to see her join a different company and debut as a soloist there. 8.) yg’s new girl group is fake  i’m pretty sure that their new girl group is just a ploy, or yg’s actually that dumb and really wants to ruin his career. if you think about it, this is an excellent marketing strategy (even if it’s not so nice). blinks will be so upset that this next comeback might be blackpink’s last that they’ll rush to buy everything that they can to support their group, which will only help yg in the end. they won’t actually debut their new girl group, but they’ll pretend that it’s in the works to get blackpink more sales. 9.) blackpink are losing credibility  i’m pretty sure that they’re not just losing fans but also their reputation as well. since they don’t appear on variety shows or attend awards shows anymore, they’re losing a sense of connection with their fans. yg doesn’t seem to understand that giving them a “too good for normal k-pop stuff” look isn’t helping them at all, or that their fans would rather have idols than models. 10.) mnet aren’t going to lose reputation (even after the produce scandal)  it pains me to write this, but mnet aren’t going to lose anything. the produce scandal was big, but iz*one is still going strong even though x1 had to disband. plus, they run a bunch of awards shows and they’re still a big company. even though it’s hard to process, a lot of things in k-pop are rigged, and everyone gets over it. mnet is too big and too important of a company, really, so they’re not going to lose much. 11.) k-pop isn’t that deep  i swear, a lot of fans find the most obscure references in the smallest things. like, some random idol from a big group could be wearing a white shirt and then some fans would do way too much research and be like, “omg this is actually a reference to (insert clip from obscure vlive here) where they said so-and-so and this proves that (insert obscure reference from their childhood) which ties in to (insert mv teaser) where they-” it’s like - no. it’s not that deep. 12.) nct has too many members  okay, so i’m not an nct stan so i really don’t get much say in this, but if i ever wanted to get into the group there’s no way i would ever learn all of their names. why can’t sm just debut them as separate groups and not sub-units that sometimes do collabs? they’re basically separate groups anyways. 13.) the concept of biases is dumb  not just the concept, but biases as a whole. why do we have to be so obsessed with people’s biases? why can’t we just love the group as a whole and not be so focused on “who’s your bias? my bias is ___.” i don’t like how a lot of conversations in k-pop are just “my bias is ____, but my bias wrecker is ____.” i don’t like how a lot of conversations about groups are about who everyone’s bias is. like, can’t we just support the group as a whole and not focus on who are favorite members are? they’re not objects to be fawned over, you know. 14.) there need to be more co-ed groups  i don’t know why every agency only debuts boy and girl groups (with the exception of a few like kard.) i would love to see more co-ed groups because i hate how everything is so divided by boy-and-girl in k-pop right now. i think that a co-ed group from a major company would be a huge turning point for fourth gen k-pop and make it really stand out. 15.) jyp is not the best company  i don’t know how many times people have said that they are, but they’re really not the best company. they overworked twice and stray kids and they probably have a bunch of scandals too, they’re just better at handling them. i know that they’re better than a lot of terrible companies like pledis and sm, but there is no “best” company because they all have flaws. EDIT: i’m back with some more unpopular opinions! 16.) itzy’s lia is not a bad dancer  i hate how this is an unpopular opinion, but it needs to be said. lia isn’t a bad dancer, in fact i think that she’s actually a pretty good idol dancer. it’s just that, compared to the rest of itzy, she isn’t as talented at dance. i personally think that all the hate around lia’s “lazy dancing” is just an excuse to hate on itzy. she’s not a bad dancer, it’s just that everyone else in itzy is much better. 17.) mia’s favoritism isn’t that bad  i know that she gets all the lines and that it’s really not fair for the rest of the members, but k-pop honestly isn’t about fair line distribution. it’s about making the best song possible, and to be honest, the rest of the vocal line in everglow aren’t very good. i mean no hate towards any of the other members, but mia is their only strong vocalist and it makes sense why she gets the most lines. with that being said, i would have loved if her dance break in dun dun was a group dance break instead. for everyone saying that e:u should have gotten the dance break: i think that mia pulls it off better than e:u would have. (EDIT: when i said that the rest of the vocal line in everglow weren’t very good, i didn’t mean that they’re bad or untalented. i wasn’t trying to discredit any of the hard work they have put in to debut and i’m not here to bash their singing skills. the reasoning behind this is, the vocal line in everglow (other than mia) are not stable while singing live and since everglow seems to have pretty intense choreography, it makes sense why their only stable vocalist gets the most lines.) 18.) beat drops are lazy  of course, there are a few good beat drops (for example: mamamoo’s starry night). but most of the time, beat drops instead of choruses just make me feel like the producer/composer was too lazy to write an actual chorus. not only does it rob the group of a proper chorus, but it just sounds rushed or sloppy in general. 19.) red velvet shouldn’t always have a group chorus  most, if not all of red velvet’s choruses are all of the group singing in harmony, which is great and i usually love it, but it doesn’t have to be all the time. i would love if they featured specific members on the chorus to showcase them more, instead of having the whole group sing. i think that it would really give members like wendy and seulgi a chance to shine. 20.) clc shouldn’t have debuted  it pains me to say it, but it’s true. clc basically only exist to make money for cube’s other groups. they have been denied so many basic k-pop group necessities: a lightstick, a solo concert, and so many other things, and it’s ridiculous considering that they’ve been around since 2015. half of their comeback mvs look cheap, especially devil. it’s disappointing that cube is throwing away their careers, especially since they have so much potential. i love clc with all my heart, but sometimes i wish that they had never debuted so that they would all be spared the pain of being neglected by cube. how do they get cheap mvs like devil but (g)i-dle get such beautiful and expensive mvs like hann? it’s just not fair to their fans, or the idols themselves. 21.) there are no “superior” stans  by that i mean that people who stan multiple “underrated” groups aren’t any more entitled to being called “better fans” than people who only stan one group. just because you’re a multi-stan doesn’t mean that you’re a better k-pop stan than someone who only stans bts. i really hate it when someone says “i really like bts!” and then someone who thinks that they’re a “superior” stan says, “well i like astro and pentagon, you’re so basic, why do you even like k-pop you obviously know nothing about it.” that’s actually so rude and it’s part of the reason why non-stans give k-pop a bad image. you’re not superior in any way, you’re just giving yourself a bad rep. 22.) visual shouldn’t be an official position  *i have a lot to say about visuals. sorry if this is controversial, but that’s why you’re reading this answer, right?* i know that south korea is really focused on beauty standards, but i don’t like how visual is a position. it’s my personal belief that tzuyu of twice probably wouldn’t be as popular if she wasn’t the visual. i mean no hate towards tzuyu, and i absolutely respect her 100% since i know how much she has struggled to become a member of twice. but the reason why she was added into twice was because of her visuals, and i think that is a source of a lot of hate from antis. if tzuyu was added because of her skills and not her visuals, i think it would mean a lot more. i know for a fact that i wouldn’t want to be the visual in a k-pop group. i think that visuals often get more focus on their face than their talents, which is wrong on so many levels. idols train for so many years, only to get focused on for their looks? it’s just a backwards system. it’s unfair to single out one specific member for being the “prettiest” one. i personally don’t agree with the concept of visuals. there’s always going to be a “prettiest” member, but do we have to put so much focus on it? the fact that we focus on visuals and not talent in k-pop disgusts me. it’s a sad truth that a lot of people have trouble accepting, but it’s true. chaeryeong of itzy is so talented and she’s an amazing dancer, but k-netz hate on her for her visuals that don’t fit the korean beauty standards. can we not just appreciate her talent? chaeryeong is so skilled at dancing and that should be what we focus on about her, not her visuals. 23.) i think that everglow buys views  this sounds really mean at first, but hear me out. this is purely speculation and i’m just theorizing. obviously, it wouldn’t be everglow who buys views, but their company. adios mv hit 100 million views, but their concerts don’t even sell half of their seats. the facts just don’t match up. this is really sad since i love everglow and they have so much potential, but buying views is not the way to go. it will only end up disappointing their fans. plus, if everglow don’t know that their company is buying views, it’s not fair to them. (EDIT: i no longer agree with this opinion. i now realize that there is absolutely a difference between casual listening/streaming and actually attending a concert in person. however, i have seen multiple seating charts for everglow’s non-us tours and they didn’t sell half of their seats. perhaps this is because they have more western fans? i’m not really sure. it’s hurtful to see comments that say i am making up information about everglow because “i hate them,” when this is absolutely not true. while i may not be a stan, i love their music and i think they have so much potential. the reason why i’m not deleting this opinion is because i believe in addressing your mistakes rather than trying to cover them up.) 24.) dating bans are okay  (as long as they end at some point.) look, i understand if a group just debuted and you need the members to focus more on their careers than dating. i think that a few years with a dating ban is totally fine if they are a rookie group and need to focus on the group, not their love lives. but saying that groups have dating bans because of toxic fans is absolute bs. toxic fans cannot rule idols’ lives, that just gives them the power that they want to have. idols such as bts and blackpink shouldn’t have dating bans because of toxic fans, they should have dating bans because they need to focus on their careers. 25.) produce groups should stay around for longer  i don’t know how unpopular this is, but i really think that only two and a half years of promoting is a bad move on mnet’s part. i understand that companies want their idols back sooner so they can start making a profit with them, but i really think that it’s a missed opportunity for mnet because produce groups are extremely popular and make good profit. 26.) twice needs a break  i don’t know if it’s because they’re overworked, but i feel like a lot of their fancy stages (especially at mbc) have been lacking stage presence. i love twice’s energy on stage, but with proper break, and not just for a month. having constant comebacks like twice does is strenuous at best. it’s definitely a good thing that mina sat out promotions for feel special, hopefully she’s like it was supposed to mean something monumental but it just fell flat for me. i wish that they had showcased their dancing skills instead of sitting on chairs. i wish that the rap line actually got a chance to rap. i wish that the vocal line didn’t feel like backing vocals. i feel like this performance left a lot to be desired. 29.) solar’s pole dancing was awkward  i’m not here to judge her for
