title track from the reve festival  i know that a lot of people had mixed feeling about this song, but i loved it from the first listen. psycho was obviously really good, umpah umpah just wasn’t released at the right time, but zimzalabim had a really infectious energy i felt and for some reason i really loved the chorus?? like i agree, psycho is some of red velvet’s best work and it’s such a great song, but i’ve always gravitated towards zimzalabim more. i don’t know whether it’s because of the negative association i have with psycho because of wendy’s injury, or if it’s because i think zimzalabim was just the girls having fun. EDIT: i’m having way too much fun with adding unpopular opinions. someone stop me please- 31.) bighit shouldn’t join the big three  this is just my opinion don’t attack me. i know that bighit ranked above jyp but i really don’t want bighit to join the big three. jyp has a big variety of groups which i think is important to be a part of the big three. bighit has two boy groups and one disbanded girl group i think, and i just don’t believe that they have enough variety to be considered a part of the big three. jyp has multiple popular and successful groups including twice, stray kids, itzy, and got7, while bighit has one mega-successful group and one that’s not as successful, but still pretty successful as well. 32.) ethnicities are not a concept  i’m looking at you, (g)i-dle. i don’t care if they want to set their comeback in an exotic place, but their entire concept shouldn’t revolve around an ethnicity. i think that when soyeon said their concept would be “ethnic hip” on queendom it was mistranslated, but i do agree that their performance of fire was a bit problematic. i know how talented (g)i-dle are, but i don’t think they should rely on different cultures for a concept. i like how they’re branching out with uh-oh and oh my god! 33.) rosé’s vocal technique is unhealthy  look, i just don’t understand why yg pushes a “unique” voice over one that doesn’t destroy your vocal chords. i think that rosé could be a very talented singer and she has a lot of potential, but not with this fake, cutesy voice that yg is pushing on her. i actually find it difficult to listen to rosé’s parts in blackpink’s songs. i hope that yg will hire an actual vocal coach so rosé can learn proper vocal technique! 34.) bts hold their mics wrong  i mean, i’m not here to bash them, but this actually really annoying once you notice it. mics have a handle for a reason, so that you don’t hold the actual microphone part and muffle your voice. and yet, bts hold the actual microphone part of the microphones despite the handle being right there in front of them. i don’t know if this is an unpopular opinion or just a fact, but i find it triggering. 35.) blinks claiming that yg doesn’t allow blackpink to write songs seems like a poor excuse  i saw this one on a subreddit but i think it’s really insightful so let me just share it with you guys! “a lot of blinks like to put that argument that the reason blackpink doesn’t write songs is because yg doesn’t allow them to. to me personally this seems like a poor excuse to make up for the fact that they don’t write songs. it is completely okay if the girls can’t/don’t want to write because not every idol is compelled to. but the blinks trying to make them look like gdragon/rm/suga level lyricists that have been oppressed by yg makes me lol. here are a couple of reasons why I think their argument stands invalid. 1. they are in yg: yg is home of artist that write their own songs. everyone in the company be it under yge or tbl is a songwriter. even somi who has just debuted last year has been credited on both birthday and outta my mind. other than that bigbang, 2ne1, ikon, winner, akmu or many other artists all write their own songs. so it makes no sense that blackpink would be stopped given that the company has a legacy of allowing artistic freedom with respect to lyrics. 2. why would yg stop them if they are good lyricists? if they can pen beautiful songs and amazing raps, why would yg stop them? wouldn’t he save a lot of money on hiring lyricists? the girls would get a positive response for being ‘artists’ and that would mean more fan support. and that would generate a lot more money. and yg loves money!? 3. some fans argue they helped write stay and jennie helped with solo. sure they could have given creative input but that doesn’t equal to actually writing the lyrics. being a lyricist would also require you to register a copyright for your work. and a whole ton of legal work too if you want to earn royalties. now if yg doesn’t give the girls their credit, it could lead to a legal mess for him. since it would basically amount to plagiarism. and I am sure with the amount of cases they have in their name, they wouldn’t want more. no idols are compelled to write music and that is okay. doesn’t make them less idols compared to others. but to purposely bring an argument to mask the fact that girls aren’t very competent lyricists is also not okay. in the past jennie has indeed mentioned that she wrote a lot of songs and had a diary of it. but that doesn’t mean all of it is worthy of becoming actual songs. given that the industry relies heavily on charts and audience perception rather than artistic expression, it makes sense if yg stopped them. maybe its time blinks accept that they don’t want to write/can’t write and move on.” 36.) i think that wannabe is itzy’s best title track  look, i loved dalla dalla and i think it was especially strong for a debut song. icy was a bit noisy and some of it just felt a bit rushed and slapped together, so it wasn’t my favorite but i still listened to it anyways. but wannabe? wannabe was what i was looking for in itzy. i loved the message more than dalla dalla (which was about being different) and icy (which was about not listening to your haters), since the message was about not wanting to be somebody else and wanting to just be yourself. the message of this song really struck a chord with me and it doesn’t hurt that the song itself is excellent too. i think that wannabe is some of itzy’s best work. 37.) i don’t like when popular western artists collab with k-pop idols  i mean, the songs are fine, but most of them are just doing it to get more listeners. i don’t like how a lot of idols are pushed to the side and forced to sing backing vocals instead, since it’s supposed to be a collab. i just wish that idols would get more fair treatment during collabs with popular western artists. i’ve never really understood why bts push collaborations on their title tracks, especially since they’re unnecessary and sometimes result in hate for the other artists. i think that ever since halsey was featured on boy with luv she’s received a lot more hate from jealous “stans.” this sort of behavior is absolutely not okay, which brings me to my next point… 38.) shipping is disrespectful  i have seen so many answers where people say “oh it’s not disrespectful to ship idols as long as you don’t take it too far,” to which i say that is absolutely not true. shipping real people should not be a thing. just because your favorite idols looked at each other for more than two seconds does not mean that you are allowed to ship them. just because your favorite idols are best friends does not mean that you are allowed to ship them. i have seen so many people excuse this sort of behavior because “they’re not doing anything harmful,” but i’m not here for it. shipping is absolutely disrespectful and can be damaging to idols’ relationships. idols are real people, not some fictional characters you can fantasize about. they have lives and they probably have relationships too, and just because k-pop is over-sexualized does not mean you are entitled to ship them. 39.) likey dance break was better than like ooh-ahh  i know that everyone loves the like ooh-ahh dance break literally so much, but i’ve always liked the likey dance break more. i agree that the like ooh-ahh dance break had better music, but i liked the choreography for the likey dance break more. momo was amazing during both dance breaks but i think she was better at the likey dance break, which makes sense since like ooh-ahh was twice’s debut song. 40.) rookie doesn’t deserve the hate  everyone, even reveluvs, really seemed to hate this comeback and i’ve never understood why. i get that the chorus gets annoying if you listen to the song more than twice in a row, but don’t even try to tell me that you don’t hum “rookie rookie, my super rookie rookie” for days after listening to it. rookie is so underrated and it doesn’t deserve the amount of hate that it gets. 41.) “fancy for soty” is annoying  everyone knew that boy with luv was going to win soty since k-pop awards are rigged, but no one would shut up about fancy for soty. it honestly got really annoying to the point that i stopped listening to fancy, even though it’s an amazing song. i love fancy with all my heart but you guys wouldn’t stop talking about fancy for soty and i just knew it wasn’t going to happen. boy with luv was much more popular internationally and probably sold a lot more than fancy, so fancy obviously wasn’t going to win. should fancy have won soty? no comment. but you guys didn’t have to shove it in anyone’s faces so hard. it’s like “stan loona” but less problematic. also can we talk about the music video like why? 42.) babying idols is not okay  this is yet another opinion i have that others have claimed is okay, when it’s really not. i think a lot of people claim that since companies make idols act cute and aegyo, it’s alright to baby them. i don’t think that babying idols to an extreme extent is okay, like calling them babies or saying that they can’t fend for themselves or calling them innocent, naive, etc. newsflash: they’re grown-ups, and that’s probably not their real personalities. it’s fine to call idols cute, but it’s not fine to think of them as children, babies, etc. these aren’t kids you’re talking about, they’re adults and they probably don’t like being seen as kids all the time. 43.) i love weird stage names  everyone hates on idols who have weird stage names, but i love them. i think that stage names are fun and unique and they’re a lot more interesting than using your given name. this is just my opinion, but i personally love rap monster and s.coups as stage names since they’re unique and fun. 44.) i don’t think oli london even likes bts  have you ever seen that one clip where he says that jungkook is the leader of the group? he honestly doesn’t know anything about bts, i think he’s just using their name to fuel his desire for plastic surgery. oli london looks nothing like jimin, if he really wanted to look like jimin then he wouldn’t look like he does now. i really think he just wants to get lots of plastic surgery done and get famous off of it, so he picked bts to help him reach stardom. everyone who thinks that oli london is a saesang might be right, but i really don’t think he even knows anything about k-pop. i don’t even think that he wants to be korean. 45.) k-pop groups don’t have to learn english  a lot of solo stans have hated on jisoo for not speaking fluent english before, but that’s honestly ridiculous. i get that blackpink promote in the western market as well, but dua lipa has collabed with blackpink and hwasa and i’m pretty sure she didn’t learn korean for that. i don’t think that a lot of k-pop stans even learn korean to talk to their faves, so why should they learn english just to talk to you? just because the group you stan has a lot of international fans doesn’t mean that they have to learn english for you guys. i think a lot of people forget that these are korean groups based in korea, not in america. jisoo is not required to learn english, the same as you are not required to learn korean to be a k-pop stan. EDIT: i’m back 46.) sakura should have won first on p48  i’m not trying to discredit wonyoung in any way because i know how hard she struggled to achieve her win on produce 48, but now that we know the voting was rigged i’m pretty sure that sakura should have won. sakura beat wonyoung in fancam views and she has a much larger fanbase as well. in almost all bias voting sakura has won first, but in every other season of produce the first place winner has been the most-biased. this isn’t fair to sakura or wonyoung if sakura’s win was taken away from her. 47.) red velvet’s debut should have been pushed back  red velvet debuted right in the middle of one of sm’s scandals, which i think was meant to distract the public from their scandal. smart marketing strategy, but there are two problems with it. one was that yeri was still too young to debut. since yeri was added into red velvet late, this has been the source of a lot of hate from k-netz. there’s actually a lot of evidence that suggests that yeri was supposed to debut with red velvet, but since their debut was rushed she couldn’t. another reason is that red velvet’s debut felt rushed. happiness mv looked sloppy and the bridge felt out of place. i mean, they were wearing cheerleading outfits in the jungle. it just felt sloppy. i like the song but the whole debut just felt rushed to take the public’s eye off of sm’s scandal. i think that if red velvet debuted later (with yeri) it just would have been a lot better. 48.) i don’t think that momoland plagiarized hip  i’m not going to say anything about the bboom bboom/mi mi mi controversy because i think it’s not really my place to say if they plagiarized their song. but i really don’t agree with everyone saying that momoland plagiarized hip because they didn’t. the songs sampled the same saxophone track, but just like momoland doesn’t own the saxophone track they used, neither does mamamoo. and honestly, can you even listen to thumbs up and tell me that it sounds exactly the same as hip? because it doesn’t. the two songs are different. there’s no need to blow it out of proportion. 49.) the double standard in k-pop is real  i’m going to use a different argument to prove my point here, as i think comparing jennie to literally any male idol ever is overused at this point. remember park bom’s drug scandal? that happened almost six years ago and k-netz still won’t let her forget it. she appeared on queendom last year which is definitely a step forward, but for years after that scandal she could barely show her face in public. and need i remind you that all park bom was doing was taking amphetamine, which is illegal in south korea but not in the us where she was prescribed? all that she had done was contact her us doctor to send her the meds because south korea’s treatment wasn’t working. meanwhile kim hyung joon admittedly hit his girlfriend but fans were quick to defend him, saying “it was one time” or “he’s changed, get over it.” the double standard in k-pop is real, so don’t even pretend like it isn’t. 50.) blackpink aren’t the next 2ne1  i know that yg himself said that he didn’t try to make any difference between the two groups (other than that blackpink was “prettier,” which is extremely rude but also extremely yg), but i personally find it rude that a lot of people call blackpink the “next 2ne1.” this is so rude to blackpink to openly call them a rip-off of 2ne1, especially since i don’t think it’s true at all. a lot of people have tried to draw “parallels” between the two groups, but i think it’s ridiculous and funny because these parallels aren’t true at all. jennie = cl (the badass leader) jennie might have a badass stage presence, but while cl is badass on and off the stage, jennie acts much cuter in real life. besides, blackpink doesn’t have an official leader. another argument is that they are both favored by yg, which is true, but that’s not their defining characteristic. i don’t think these two are similar at all. jisoo = dara (the 4d visual) while jisoo and dara might have 4d personalities, their personalities are also very different. if you’ve ever watched a clip of dara and jisoo in your lives then you’ll know that their sense of humor is very different. and while both dara and jisoo are visuals, i don’t see a lot of people saying that yuna is a rip-off of tzuyu. rosé = bom (the unique voice) although rosé and bom may both have unique voices and are the main vocals of their groups, i genuinely don’t think that rosé and bom are anything alike. they have very different personalities and their vocal color is different as well. lisa = minzy (the dance machine maknae) i don’t even have to be a dance expert to say that lisa and minzy’s style of dance is very different. lisa has a more hip-hop style while minzy looks more fluid and flexible on stage. besides, their rap style is very different so you can’t even compare their rapping either. i know that this description is long, but it really does make me mad when people call blackpink the “next 2ne1.” just because both groups have the same amount of members and a girl crush concept does not mean that they are copies of each other. 2ne1 has a fun, vibrant, in-your-face vibe while blackpink seem more effortlessly cool and elegant. they’re two different groups, and some people just need to accept it. 51.) gahyeon should be the lead rapper  i think that sua is the lead rapper in dreamcatcher but i honestly like gahyeon’s rapping more. sua seems to sing more as well and i think her voice is more suited to vocals. gahyeon has rapped in some of their more recent songs and i really like her tone. i don’t know a lot about rapping but i think gahyeon deserves the lead rapper position. 52.) like ooh-ahh wasn’t the best  a lot of once’s love this song to death but to be honest, other than the dance break this song wasn’t that good. twice’s vocals weren’t very strong at the time and some of the sound effects weren’t that great. momo’s dance break carried this song and without it, i don’t think it would be as popular. i know that a lot of once’s love this song because it’s twice’s debut song, but it’s not one of their best songs. for a debut song, it’s good, but it’s not as good as some people claim. also, the music video was very random and not in a good way. 53.) red flavor would have been one of rv’s best songs if not for that sound effect  if you’ve ever listened to red flavor you know exactly what i’m talking about. that god-awful sound effect (i don’t even know what if was, but it was just awful) completely ruined the whole song for me. it’s so annoying because i love red flavor but i can’t stand the sound effect. red flavor is such a good song and i would consider it one of rv’s best summer songs if not for that sound effect. 54.) the maknae line in bts overshadows the hyung line  i really wish that they didn’t, but a lot of armys talk about jimin, v, and jungkook way more than they talk about rm, jin, suga, and j-hope. i don’t have a problem if some members are more popular than others, but when it comes to bts it really bothers me because a lot of people totally ignore the hyung line in favor of the maknae line. it’s fine if some members are slightly more popular, but to this extent it’s a little bit rude. 55.) guessing idol’s sexualities is weird  i can’t tell you how many times i’ve seen fandoms claim wild things about idol’s sexualities. it’s like, i hate to break it to you, but not every idol in every group is going to be a member of the lgbtq+ community and that’s okay. naturally some idols will be a member of the lgbtq+ community but that doesn’t mean you have the right to make wild claims and speculations about their sexualities because that’s really not any of your business. speculating about idol’s sexualities is disrespectful and makes you look ignorant. 56.) power up is red velvet’s prettiest mv  i know a lot of people would put psycho or peek a boo up there but power up is their prettiest music video by far. a lot of red velvet’s summer songs have awful music videos so i didn’t have high hopes for this one, but it was so pretty. from the colors to the styling to the scenes, everything was just beautiful. 57.) really bad boy and bad boy aren’t the same  everyone attacked red velvet for releasing really bad boy because it was a “copy” of bad boy, but honestly i don’t think that’s true. apart from the similar titles, these songs have very different vibes and i honestly don’t think they’re comparable. i’m not saying which is better (since that’s overused) but i don’t think they sound the same. 58.) excessive hair-dying needs to stop  a lot of people have been saying that idols look better with natural hair colors, and i agree for the most part. i do think that a lot of idols look amazing with dyed hair, but i dislike the trend of neon hair dye since i think that’s become a much-hated stereotype of k-pop. i don’t mind softer or more subtle colors, but bright blue and pink look cheap and limit the amount of outfits an idol can wear (which is inconvenient because they are expected to wear different outfits for every stage). 59.) yuna’s bangs aren’t bad  honestly, i don’t mind her bangs and i do think that yuna would look nice with bangs, except that her hair color detracts from it all. i think if her bangs were a little bit thinner and they went with a lighter color for her hair (like in itzy) she would look amazing with bangs. 60.) idols don’t have to be talented  i mean, of course they have to be a little bit skilled, since they are in a music group, but i don’t really think that k-pop is about the music anymore. of course, it wouldn’t be k-pop without the music, but a lot of fans are drawn in because of their personalities and not their music. i’m not speaking for everyone, but i do think that this is the case. idols don’t have to be talented to debut as long as they have an interesting personality or beautiful visual. (EDIT: talent and skill are different things. i would argue that most, if not all idols are skilled, but having a talent for dance/rap/singing is very different. i would say that all idols deserve to have debuted, but they aren’t all necessarily talented.) . . . ~momoko!!

Here we go! 1. ATEEZ are one of the most promising rookie groups.  Don't know them? Listen to Wave, Hala Hala, Say My Name, Pirate King and many more songs. They're surprisingly really awesome. These years will be dominated by BIGHIT and JYP rookie groups (let's see what happens when SM and YG debut their rookie groups) but, Ateez sure as hell made a name for themselves. 2. Blackpink…well Blackpink. They are on every other answer so….  Well they lost me. What can you expect from like six comebacks and less than 20 songs? I mean, Ateez and TXT are rookies and they still have more songs than Blackpink. I am still looking forward to their first album which is like months away. Also their badass thingy is becoming kind of boring now. And yes, YG did say they prefer quality over quantity but we all know better than to believe those liars. Besides, I don't think their songs are really that good. They're repetitive, have nonsense lyrics most of the time. Sure they're catchy as hell but that is not the point. Talent doesn't always guarantee you popularity. Blackpink is talented but so is every other group in Kpop. 3. GOT7 deserves better.  Their company is notorious for favoring girl groups. Heck, Twice and Itzy are really popular. More popular than GOT7 and Stray Kids. a) They deserve more self produced songs because JYP songs aren't doing any wonders for them. JYP boy groups are free to make their own songs (GOT7 to some extent, SKZ's 3RACHA makes every one of their songs) but their girl groups are not. However, twice did participated a bit in Feel Special. And it is evident that their girl groups make more money (look at itzy who got instant success with their debut) so it's obvious JYP favors the Girls. It hurt so bad when he said GOT7 was at the bottom of waiting list. b) They deserve better rap verses. God knows that GOT7 would blow up the world if they had rap verses of SKZ, or like Girls Girls Girls or something. I've noticed that the rap was nonexistent in Eclipse, You Calling My Name and Not by the moon. c) and of course better treatment, more exposure in TV shows, and boycotting MAMA. d) More International promotions, GOT7 has 3 foreign members for god sake. And our Jinyoung is also rapidly transforming from a Korean into an Englishman. Haha. So guess who is JYP's biggest shot at success abroad? GOT7. And secondly itzy, because of their badass concept. They could be the next blackpink. But better. TWICE aren't suited for promoting in US, GOT7 IS. Is that why they're changing twice's concept? Honestly, Fancy was okay but Feel Special and More and More seemed like they're missing something. Back to GOT7. They have Mark. Who is btw from LA. And BAMBAM who is treated like a king in Thailand. And of course, Jackson Wang. He's big in China. What does twice have? 6 Korean members and 3 Japanese members. They do well in Korea and Japan alike. 3. TXT and ITZY are successful because of BTS and TWICE.  “BTS brother group 😍😍I'm gonna stan them ajhvfhdksakavggrsj” Big Hit ent. becoming Big Hit Labels proved Kpop is becoming Big4 now. BTS's popularity and Army played a very big role in making TXT so famous. Those boys are good at what they do. They're talented. With itzy, their Dalla Dalla became viral. Some accused them of copying Blackpink but that's meh. Because Chaeryeong was in Sixteen, Once know her, support her. Ryujin is famous for she is a nice dancer. And Yuna was once talked about because she looked like Lee Seyoung. Twice's huge fanbase accepted their little sisters pretty nicely and itzy also brought a lot of new fans for themselves. TXT and ITZY won Rookie Grand Slam within their first year. I think obviously them being from big companies, (also BIGHIT and JYP are friends) led them being side by side(MAMA arranged their performance closely, kept them together),which isn't a bad thing anyway. Coming from a big and rich company pays well. 4. I don't like BTS anymore.  They're overrated and overhyped. Really. BTS introduced me to kpop when I heard ‘Waste it on me’ in 2018. I was so crazy about them, I liked Blackpink too. Then I hated like everyone who said anything bad about them. I don't like them anymore. I didn't like MOTS 7. They're not gods, they're not the only group in kpop, and while they've achieved a lot of things in west and east, they did not pave the way. I don't like the autotune they use and people say they make their own music? A lot of people help them in making their own music. You say they make songs about society and mental issues etc. A lot of people do that too. Besides, music will still be music if it doesn't have society and blah blah. So what? They were supposed to be a hip hop group? That's okay. People worship them? That's okay. I don't. They're good. But not my favorite anymore. 5. SM should have promoted their idols better in the west.  SM Ent. doesn't promote their idols in the west. Maybe they couldn't anticipate BTS will become so big there. Ha! Even though EXO didn't promote, they nailed it. ‘Don't Mess Up My Tempo ‘ and ‘Love Shot ‘ continued their streaks for superhit songs. Had they promoted EXO and Red Velvet in the west, it would've been world domination. Actually their thinking has always been to promote in China. They made another group in 2016 named NCT that promotes in the west. 6. RED VELVET is the best girl group.  Yes. Better than any girl group. You must be aware of top three girl groups of Korea- Blackpink, Twice, Red Velvet. Why is Red Velvet better? Vocals ✔️ Visuals✔️ Choreography ✔️ They rap nicely too. Whatever is the standard in there because for me, my fav. female rapper is Mamamoo's Moonbyul. Red Velvet's songs are versatile, catchy and different than others. Trust me, I'm not being biased. They have such a wide range of concepts, and they nailed every single one of them. Let's just judge by music. Rookie, Dumb Dumb, Ice Cream Cake, Russian Roulette, Red Flavor, Umpah Umpah, Bad Boy, RBB, Zimzalabim and Psycho! While twice has been doing cute concepts since their debut - Like ooh aah, Cheer Up, Yes Or Yes, TT, Signal etc. They're changing concepts now though. Fancy was sexy. Feel Special was okay. And More and More was just weird to me. Okay, I'll add more later bye… Let's Love💕

response.answer_text: My first ever unpopular Kpop opinion, I considered putting a trigger warning but yall get even more curious when that happens, so theres no point at ALL but either way im warning you I'm about to spill some hot tea 🍵 This will be long btw. EVERY company has favorites whether it is 2 or 1 member, EVERY company.I’m probably going to be cursed with every word in the book for this one but it’s true every company does have a member they particularly push or favor among the group, is it fair ? not really, is it understandable? Yes definitely, some companies tend to be obvious with their favoritism like YG with their rappers and others are subtle like BigHit, and some take it to a whole new level of creating a group that consists of their favorites *Looking directly at you SM*, the point is fans need to accept that companies have favorites, you can bark all day but it isn't changing a thing. 2. I'm convinced Kpop fans aren't human, calling them aliens would put those cute little creatures to shame The horror I see in Twitter espically can't be humans doing, this isn't hate, this isn't jealousy this runs deep down that I can't even comprehend it anymore, this is psychos behavior, I dont mean to insult anyone but this isnt normal, what do they actually get from insulting groups all day or hating on that member and trying to destroy careers every day, whatever they are they need to get some time out and go breath some fresh air, this isn't healthy. 3. The Twice cant sing agenda needs to go. Listen you self claimed vocal coaches who knows absolutely nothing about singing, Twice can sing, Twice can make any song theirs, Twice are talented and if you think otherwise you need to keep that embarrassment to yourself, Momo isn't the best singer and she does need some training, but that doesn't mean you have to rub it in our faces and call her untalented, we get it Karen you're tastless move on. 4. Stability =/ bad vocalists I don't know who needs to hear this but just because a group isn't stable live (target BP and imma whoop your ass, my girls improved they be eating CDs) doesnt mean they're the worst singers to ever exist, if they are as some fans claim then who the hell does the recording, autotune or not they're still singing, it's still their voices what's not clicking, live singing isnt everything, yes its a part of a good vocalist and it shows their skills but its not all. 5. Lip-syncing in more than 5–10 performances isnt OK. Go ahead and throw me in the ocean, I'm one of those people who like to hear live and fresh vocals, and I just happen to dislike Lip-syncing extremely, but that doesnt mean I want EVERY performance live and perfect, idols have their bad days, some of them are really overworked and I dont expect them to be perfect, but lip-syncing on every performance isnt acceptable, its their job at the end of the day to sing, dance and rap, its the path they chose, im not paying to see my idols glamed up like dolls im paying to see them and enjoy a performance live, theres no excuse for idols to lip-sync more than 10 times its their job no one forced them. 6. I love Suga but the whole Jim Jones situation threw me off. All of us were excited when his second mixtape dropped and everything was perfect till we found out about the speech and what did BigHit do throw an apology like it doesnt matter and armys ate it up and buried black armys feeling underground, while Suga acted blind like this whole situation isnt his fault when we saw him with our own eyes working on the song and the entire mixtape, he didn't apologize and he didn't say anything about it casue he knows armys and his company will protect him, I'm not convinced with the apology and I can never forgive him for the trauma that he and armys caused that day, I speak as an African when I say this, the situation still hunts me to this day, if something like this happens again he's just gonna drop us like we dont matter, its really heartbreaking I can never forgive him for this, and it isn't about the song its about his behavior to the whole scandal, he chose to ignore everything and move on when some of us are still deeply triggered, im really disappointed with this i never expected him to ever do something like this, you can call me an anti for all I care, I'm a human before a fan, I'm African and im proud, even if I love him, I can never forgive Min Yoongi for this. 7. Armys don't feel like home or family anymore. I stanned BTS before their huge sucess (Just because I dont write about them on Qoura doesnt mean I'm a fake army, I'm more active on other apps more than Qoura) back then everything was actually hard, I won't deny it but even then the fandom was connected, they were fun, we used to defend BTS and go back to living in our own little universe that was made just for us and share our love for the group, it was way easier, no one would guilt trip anyone for not streaming, not everything was about achievements or awards, we didn't use to downgrade every group and call them flops just because they arent BTS, we used to voice our opinions without being called antis and fake armys we used to get along with many fandoms and we used to be more friendly, solo stans wasn't a thing back then, to be fair some of these people still exist but the majority isnt like this anymore, everything is for bragging rights these days and the amount of obsessed fans is frightening, the group may thrive but the fandom won't, the family that armys claim exist perished, its honestly heartbreaking. It wasnt the perfect little world, but I'd never trade it for any fandom. 8. BigHit give me bad vibes, I dont like the company at all. Its not about the JJ situation with Suga nor is it because Im a V stan, but this company seems quite shady to me, I can't explain my feelings in particular but there's something off and its crystal clear to me, they arent perfect we all know that but I can't shrug the feeling that there's a bomb thats about to drop anytime in the future, I really don't like the company or the CEO, they scream fishy to me. 9. Some of the things fans drag others for when they voice their opinion on a specific point about a certain group is originally created by the fandom. Big Hit Entertainment You are a K-pop fan if you only stan BTS, as long as you aren't a toxic ARMY.ARMYs are not the most toxic fans. Some people can be immature or rude, but who they are online doesn't reflect their full personality. Besides, the size of the fandom is so big that there are bound to be some fans like that. Other fandoms arguably have equally toxic fans.Hyung line members aren't underrated anymore, but new ARMYs should still appreciate them and not just the maknae line.The LY trilogy are better albums, as a whole than Young Forever, YNWA, HYYH and HYYH pt. 2, and WINGS, but the Young Forever, YNWA, HYYH and HYYH pt. 2, and WINGS albums' individual songs are better.DNA was not a flop in my opinion, but the fact that it was overhyped compared to other title tracks caused it to become unappealing to some fans.Fake Love and IDOL shouldn't have been the title tracks- I feel like other songs would have fit better as MVs but not as a visual aspect for them (other songs in the album would have been better but Fake Love and IDOL's concepts fit music videos better visually).I don't really like their first few albums because I'm not really into the hip-hop genre, but some individual songs were good.I don't watch the Japanese MVs, I'm not really into Japanese versions of songs in general.I didn't like V's visuals at first, probably because it was so different from the other members'.My first bias was Jungkook because I was a typical new ARMY, but I soon came to love hyung line more than the maknae line (sorry, but I feel like the hyung line's producing talents are going to take them farther than their rapping or vocal abilities).Big Hit was a problematic company before BTS, but I feel like BTS made people forget about that fact. Even during BTS' career, there are still some major scandals.The BTS Fake Love Jungkook x Charlie Puth stage was not a flop. Charlie Puth's intentions for doing the collab may have been misinterpreted, and there were definitely many technical issues, but it goes to show how broad BTS can expand their horizons.K-pop fans should stop hating on American artists as well as other idols. Artists work hard to keep their fans happy!Big Hit will not be a part of the Big 3 anytime soon. Due to SM, YG, and JYP Entertainment's historical impact on the K-Pop industry, they will continue to remain the Big 3 even though BTS earns more money alone than any one of the three companies, they simply don't have enough of a historical impact (compared to SM, JYP, and YG).If Big Hit does manage to become part of the Big 3, then they will replace YG Entertainment but only at least several years after 6ACES' debut.Speaking of TXT, their success will hinge on whether Big Hit is able to manage two groups at once (one of which is already unspeakably famous and the latter of which will gain most of their popularity from the success of the other group).YG Entertainment YG is the least deserving of the 3 Big 3 groups to earn that title. They don't train their idols well and push their idols to do some things that they aren't comfortable with.YG's new boy group will determine the overall success of the company after they debut.Bang Yedam is too good for YG. If he isn’t the leader of TREASURE 13, I have no idea what YG is doing with its future.I don't really keep up with BLACKPINK, but if they were managed better by YG, I feel like they would be more successful (right now I feel like they are being ignored by YG).I feel like the fact that Jennie has been dating with Kai has something to do with the controversy of her being 'lazy'.As with the controversy, I feel like she is becoming less enthusiastic with choreo, but I don't think it's fully her fault, YG is playing a part in it.At first, I interpreted Jennie's 'SOLO' as her distancing herself from BP ("I'm going solo") and as justification for her attitude, and I feel like if that's the case, she shouldn't have done that.Blackpink doesn't deserve the high number of views or awards for their songs. I feel like the songs aren't really anything special and the MVs don't have any special meaning.I don't really like BP's members' attitudes. Jisoo is the most toned-down in my opinion, so I dislike her the least out of all the members. However, I feel like they are being forced to act a certain way and I don't really get it since it doesn't appeal to a lot of people (including yours truly) and doesn't benefit the members or their company.If BP disbands, it's for the better, unless YG steps their game up and actually focuses on them.Jennie and Kai dating is a way to attract people's attention toward Blackpink but not in the way that YG may have wanted.BIGBANG was and still is the highlight of YG's Entertainment's career.SM Entertainment SM has the best merch, music videos, and artistry out of the entire industry, but the way they treat some groups and members are just corrupted.(About the Kai and Jennie dating situation) I feel like their relationship isn't genuine and they don't go well together.NCT China line is my favorite line (coming from an ABC here).EXO's declining popularity is entirely SM's fault. They completely stopped promoting them a year or two ago and now their success is going downhill.The EXO-L fandom is much less toxic after the problematic fans left (possibly due to EXO's decrease in success or the fanwars between ARMY and EXO-Ls). It's gotten a lot better but some fanwars are inevitably going to happen.If EXO's rap line was as skilled as BTS (in my opinion, BTS' rap line is much better than EXO, please don't kill me) and their songs weren't all about one topic (mainly love), they would be way more successful.The three members that left (Luhan, Kris, and Tao) are justified in their reasons for leaving (which also goes to show how corrupted SM is [not that all the K-pop industry as a whole is corrupt]).JYP Entertainment JYP is the best company out of the Big 3, hands down. They treat their idols decently and also train them very well. Also very unproblematic compared to the other entertainment companiesStray Kids is going to become very popular in 2019 - they produce and write their own songs and lyrics, choreograph their own dances, and earned 5 ROTY awards (as of the time I am writing this), all before their 1st anniversary! Sadly but inevitably, they will get haters, but after BTS' major success, people are now scared to drag down rookie groups.Stray Kids are one of the most unproblematic groups there are.Stray Kids is not successful only because they are under one of the Big 3 companies. They have worked extremely hard to earn what they have right now.I disliked Bang Chan's visuals at first but now I want to kill myself for thinking such a thing.DAY6 is amazing. They were the first band I stanned and it gave me a completely new look on K-pop (*cough* ‘Shoot Me’ *cough* <- It's such a bop!!!!).TWICE is also a great group, but I like their more recent releases more than their previous ones. ‘DTNA’ was surprising to me since it wasn't a cute concept (like TWICE had been doing before) and ‘The Best Thing I Ever Did’ - absolutely amazing and refreshing! I only like select songs before ‘DTNA’, such as ‘Like Ooh-Ahh’. ‘YES OR YES’ didn't appeal to me and seemed like a weird combination of cute concept and girl crush concept. Also, I found the members smiling in the beginning of the video creepy and slightly weird.Other I like boy groups way more than girl groups because their concepts appeal more to me.Talking about concepts, 2NE1 did indeed create the 'girl crush' concept. Also, I don't like overly cute (bubblegum) concepts. I feel like the artists are straining their voice to make it sound more cutesy or girly, which I hate. The songs are overly catchy and infectious (not in a good way) but I can tolerate SOME cute concepts.Girl and boy group choreos can't be compared in terms of difficulty.Solo artists deserve more love!!!!BTS and SKZ need to rest!! They need it - we can go without one comeback, but imagine the toll it takes on your body to do all that!MOMOLAND will either become very popular or flop.(G)-IDLE is a pretty good group.N.Flying, The Rose, and DAY6 are the best bands.Stray Kids, The Boyz, and ATEEZ are the power rookie boy group trio of this generation.SHINee, EXO, and BIGBANG are the kings of K-pop as we know it today (sorry if I missed your fave, it's just my opinion).Wanna One deserves the hype that they get. ‘Energetic’ was a great debut song. Although their other songs weren’t outstanding, they were solid and they ended their career amazingly with “Spring Breeze’.While we are on the topic of Wanna One, their disbandment was too premature, they could have gotten way farther if they had stayed together longer. Also - goodbye Wanna One T_T I loved you and love you still…BOY STORY is an okay group, but I just don't feel comfortable stanning people who are younger than me. Also, your voice changes after you hit puberty, and they may need to adjust to using a whole new vocal technique (I’m considering them as K-pop because they trained under JYP, even though they are Chinese).Monbebes, Carats, STAY, and AROHA are very nice fandoms to be in.K-pop fans are more likely to be more open-minded to other things and less judgemental than non-fans (according to observations made by yours truly).People who don't like K-pop because it's 'gay' or are too judgmental or closed-minded honestly don't make any sense (unfortunately I am surrounded by these people every day).On a brighter note, Amber and Jae (DAY6) are hands down my favorite Tweeters of all time - they have me dead on the floor laughing every damn time lmaoSo that's it! If I missed your fave, please don't kill me, I'm human too and things really get in the way of stanning every artist and group possible T_T You don't have to completely agree with me, but please respect my opinions. Anyways, I hope you liked my extensive K-pop opinions which weren't really 'unpopular', per se, but I needed to get them off my chest for a long time. I'll be back with more soon and hope you all enjoyed reading this! Hwaiting, Priscilla Ye Edit: I have changed some opinions (mostly about SM) as I have gotten into SM artists and groups a lot more.

Hello, so basically i had already done an answer similar to the same question, but the great Quora decided to collapse it after it hit 50K+ and oh boy that hurt because i spent hours doing it.  Okay let’s just get started: 1. BTS didn’t pave the way:Armies: Wow! Our BTS oppas paved the way internationally! They’re the best! They’re kings! Psy isn’t just Gangnam style, he has been in the industry since 2001. Do you know how hard it was for him at the beginning? The managers of YG argued about his “ugly” looks right in front of him. He had to cover/ hide his face at the beginning of his career because he didn’t fit the beauty standards despite being a respected artist in South Korea. Also, SM himself is an Orbit, and helped produce Loona’s “So What!” If y’all orbits aren’t thankful for this amazing man then idk what to say. 4. SM ent. is the best company:It isn’t the #1 company for nothing. Yes, the trainees are overworked and the training is extremely hard but that’s simply because it’s SM ent. In SM groups they have multiple personalities, some members are quiet, while others are talkative, introverts and extroverts, baddies and cuties, colds and warms. Idols can honestly be themselves. Black Pink isn’t the best girl group and Blinks are the most toxic fandom:Blinks will literally kill me for this. But guess what? I used to be a Blink myself. Momo is an amazing and strong woman with a strong mentality, why would she cry? This is what happened: Heechul, Dong Yup and a female artist (idk her) were hosting an award ceremony, and Shin Dong Yup said: “Heechul, i bet you’re happy to see you’re special people here”. Loona is the best girl group, alongside Red Velvet:These two groups are amazing. No words can explain how much i love them and how amazing they are.   11. K-Quorans are the best and most mature K-pop fans:I literally love you mature K-Quorans so much. Like so much. So so much. You guys attack my heart with your kindness, love and sense of humor.  12. There’s no Big 4:Seriously though, wtf is a Big 4?  There is, was, and will only be Big 3. What some fans don’t get is that the Big # aren’t the companies with the most popular artists, but it’s the companies who helped form K-pop, who helped shape and make K-pop. And the companies who did that are SME: the one who basically started K-pop by debuting H.O.T, YGE: after Seo Taiji and boys, Yang Hyun suk made YGE and debuted his own groups, and JYPE: who followed their path. These 3 are the ones who created, started, and shaped K-pop and that’s why they’re called the Big 3. Not because they have famous groups. The ones who usually use the term Big 4 are newer K-pop fans so kids, there is no Big 4. These are more like thoughts of my observations than just bland opinions. And there they go : Once a group or an k-idol start becoming widely popular and successful, people start to neglect the base they had to start with and hard work they had to begin and muster with: we all know the hardships the idols have to face to perform on the stage ; doing what they love to do. The stage we observe, the mvs we stream, the fanmeet we visit all seems so alluring. The concerts seems so mesmerizing at a point that the dream of performing among the crowds of thousands allures us too. For this point I won't be mentioning just one group or a fandom but as a whole. Imagine excitedly auditioning for a company, imagine the happiness of being selected and imagine the hit of euphoric waves to be able to get debuted. And this is what we just see. We ignore their hard work. The idols we love are getting hated. Some of the popular names let's include bts, twice, exo and blackpink . Bts was called a ‘nugu' group meaning who in a sense unknown to all. Exo was hated for being a failure to sm. Twice was hated for their survival show being planned which was not. Last but not least blackpink was hated because they debuted when 2ne1 disbanded. The fandoms of each respective group know how much their idols had to suffer humiliation and loss of enthusiasm to continue what they liked to do for they had no idea what the future has stored for them. You know the feeling when you draw a picture of ur family members so enthusiastically and get ignored? The pain you feel is unexplainable and all you wanna do is cry and good thing is you can. But imagine being hated in your group just for breathing and you know what's worse? You can't even cry for you will be bashed out again for being unprofessional. The above mentioned groups are now hugely popular from east to west. When people first call kpop most of us will be strucked with their name, for they hold such popularity. And people think everything came easy to them just watching the present them winning the awards. And here comes the train of overwhelming hate which none of them deserve. Ik we all can't get into their songs they give to their fans but neither can we just send them endless hate and death threats. They are humans not puppets that are left to be played by us. And none of the idols we see had easy trainee periods. Just because they are popular now doesn't mean their past was any easy. They have worked hard for their present and we can't lose our humanity by typing hate comments than doing anything fruitful. Idols don't control our life and I think neither should you. . Most of the kpop fandom know about scandals but don't care about the truth about it being fake: This one is targeted particularly to one idol named lee taeyong. Does that name ring a bell? Yeah he is that idol known inside k-fandom for being a scammer and a bully. But does the fandom know that it was fake? Trust me even his own fandom we know as nctzens didn't know abt it. And I could see so many careless answers about taeyong saying taeyong this and taeyong that. AND GUESS WHAT HE KEPT THE PAIN IN HIMSELF. Why you may ask? This is the second time I am answering this type of question but anyway, get ready for some shade: Boy with luv is an okay song, but not song of the year, it is not as good as other BTS songs, the only reason it won so many awards because of the huge fandom. Give it to a group with average to below average popularity, it will flop.MR removed videos aren’t that reliable, stop evaluating someone’s vocal capabilities by watching them: Live singing isn’t everything, there are more criterias. Also mr removed can be edited, twisted to sound bad or better than it is.Talent isn’t everything and is definitely not the deciding factor in this industry. When I first knew Kpop, I was really childish and thought visual members with little talents are useless and don’t deserve their fame, that you must be super talented to actually deserve anything. Now I realize what is really important is the star quality that JYP talks about. In survival shows, it’s not the most talented ones that win, it’s the people who manage to grab the audience’s attention and shine onstage. That’s why the best dancers and singers from SIXTEEN got eliminated, you rely too much on your skills. If you want to maintain your fame, you have to be flexible and be interesting in different ways. Another fundamental factor is a good personality. You can destroy your career if your attitude isn’t very nice. And no, I am not underestimating the value of talents. But you need way more than talent to be the star of your group. That’s why Lisa, Momo, Yeji, V, etc are so popular anyway. They are talented but they manage to stand out onstage, which come to my next point:Wonyoung does well enough as center, Chaeyeon’s rank should have been higher but not the 1st place. I am speaking this as a person who supported Chaeyeon from the start. The 12th rank pissed me off, she should have been in the top 5 or top 3. But you know what, I wouldn’t give her the center spot because she doesn’t suit it. I always see her as some type of wildcards like Chungha, Momo but not someone who represent everyone like Nayeon. Nayeon’s existence screams TWICE, that’s what a center is. To be honest, IZ*ONE concept is too girly for her anyway. She would make the excellent center in a WM girl group. I would give her more important lines and a good amount of center time instead. And no, she is not underrated at all, the company knows and promoted her dancing quite well and she is one of the most loved. The only problems are her screen time and her style which the stylist is too lazy to change. For Wonyoung, she wasn’t my dream center but she doesn’t deserve all the hate thrown at her on her birthday either. She suits the concept pretty well. She actually does have some kind of presence onstage and she’s 15, give her a chance.Not stanning a kpop group because of the fandom is totally okay. I have listened to a lot of groups and artists and I like a lot of them, TWICE, BLACKPINK, BTS,etc. However, I find the fandom too toxic and childish to be part of. Most of the time I am just a silent supporter and that is totally okay. You might call me childish and a fake stan but you are supposed to be happy, feeling positive when listening to music and seeing idols, not dealing with toxic people 24/7. Just because you are in the same fandom does not mean they are going to treat you nicely. Leave when you feel uncomforable. I only join a fandom when I really know it is suitable for me. Most of the time, I am just a silent supporterStanning idol does not mean worshipping them like a perfect human being, it is totally okay to accept your idols have weaknesses: I mean fans often accuse when a self proclaimed fan who said that:”Even though A is my bias, I think X is better at dancing/singing/etc than A” for being a fake fan. For me those oversensitive fans are hypocrites. Just because my bias is Mina does not mean I am going to go around saying she dances better than Momo. No, that is just stupid. In my opinion, a true fan love the perfect and imperfect in their idols. Idols are only humans, they make mistakes, they are not good at a particular stuff. Always babying your idols and not accepting their weak points is actually a harmful way of supporting.Everglow use ads, so what? As a matter fact, almost all kpop groups nowadays use ads, even the big 3 groups. Moreover, Youtube has already stopped counting views from ads, they have lots of real views, just accept the truth. You just find the pettiest reasons to hate on someone because you feel threatenedStop with the conception that visuals are useless Astro’s Cha Eunwoo brought up his group’s popularity with his visuals. Irene brings a lot of attention to her group. Without Hani, EXID would have disbanded long ago. Be grateful for what they have contributed and stop hating on them and autonatically brand them as talentless. Suzy is a well-rounded idol, IOI/Pristin’s Kyulkyung was both a good dancer and a nice vocalist.Somi doesn’t deserve the hate she got after leaving JYPE: Look, she doesn’t hate Twice and she is still pretty close with some of them, especially Chaeyoung. Somi is young, she is impulsive and can make rash and immature actions, but does an Instagram post speak all about someone’s character? No. Somi are close with plenty of sunbaenims like Zico or Taeyeon, if she was disrespectful or bitchy, no one would have wanted to befriend her. Her interaction with Itzy’s 01 line was nothing but nice. And no, she isn’t taking advantage of Twice. All 9 girls are older, more experienced and they know what they are doing, they are not your babies. So toxic stans need to shut up. And stop saying she should be in a group or stay with JYP, yes, I liked her as a GG member more but if idols are enjoying what they are doing in the moment, there is no need to keep questioning and trying to change her decision.
